name: Slides
tagline: a collection of presentations using Github pages
body:
### Welcome to GitHub Pages of @jr0cket, community developer.

I have create several presentations on developer tools and using Clojure for functional programming. Each slide deck is an HTML5 webpage for easy viewing.  Each presentation was written in plain text using Emacs Org-mode and converted into HTML that use the JavaScript and CSS from Reveal.js.  

## Current presentations

* [JAX London 2013 - Clojure at Lightspeed](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/jax-london-2013-light-table.html) -- !work in progress!
* [JAX London 2013 - Play on Heroku](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/jax-london-2013-play-on-heroku.html)
* [Kickstart your Hack with Git and Heroku](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/kick-start-your-hack-with-git-and-heroku.html)
* [Getting started with Git](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/getting-started-with-git.html) - !work in progress!
* [Even Developers can present](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/even-developers-can-present.html) - a brief guide to giving your first talk 
* [Getting started with Clojure](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/getting-started-with-clojure.html)
* [Presenting with Emacs](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/presenting-with-emacs.html)
* [Introduction to RevealJS (the original)](http://jr0cket.github.io/slides/revealjs.html)

## Visual developer guides

A range of [visual guides for developers](http://jr0cket.github.io/developer-guides)

## Heroku related workshops

* [Git and Github workshop](http://jr0cket.co.uk/git-workshop)
* [Building an app with Java and Play framework](http://jr0cket.co.uk/heroku-java-play-workshop)
* [Building lightweight apps with JavaScript and Meteor](http://javascript-javascript-meteor-workshop) - to be replaced with JavaScript & Angular workshops

## Other Developer outpourings
I also write articles on these topics and many more at [jr0cket.co.uk](http://jr0cket.co.uk) and can be reached via [twitter](http://twitter.com/jr0cket)

I have some traditional style presentations on [SlideShare.net](http://www.slideshare.net/JR0cket)

Thank you.
John Stevenson
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
